meanings.definition: A small, rounded underground storage organ of a plant, similar to a bulb
meanings.sent1: The gardener planted cormels to grow beautiful flowers in the garden.
meanings.sent2: Farmers harvest cormels like potatoes for food.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous squirrel buried the cormels in the wrong spot, thinking they were acorns.
meanings.sent4: Her ideas were cormels waiting to sprout into full-fledged projects.
meanings.sent5: The cormels were snug in the earth, waiting for spring to come and bloom.

meanings.definition: Small, fleshy, seed-bearing structures found in certain types of algae
meanings.sent1: The scientist studied the cormels under the microscope to understand their reproductive process.
meanings.sent2: The ocean waves carried the cormels to new locations, helping algae spread.
meanings.sent3: The cormels in the algae looked like tiny jewels glistening in the sunlight.
meanings.sent4: The cormels of the algae danced in the water, a delicate ballet of life.
meanings.sent5: Under the surface, the cormels of the algae held the promise of new growth and vitality.
